Name: sprint_backlog_must_not_exceed_velocity
Description: The total story points of user stories assigned to a sprint must not exceed the team's established velocity.

Name: worker_availability_must_be_respected
Description: The total effort of tasks assigned to a worker in a sprint must not exceed their available capacity.

Name: project_budget_must_not_be_exceeded
Description: The total cost incurred by the project must remain at or below the allocated budget.

Name: team_size_must_be_within_scrum_limits
Description: The number of workers on a team should be within the effective range for a Scrum team (e.g., 3 to 9 members).

Name: task_must_have_required_skills
Description: A worker assigned to a task must possess the necessary skill required for that task.

Name: sprint_must_have_a_goal
Description: Every sprint that is planned must have a clearly defined Sprint Goal.

Name: epic_must_be_broken_down
Description: An Epic cannot be directly placed into a Sprint Backlog; it must first be broken down into User Stories.

Name: a_sprint_has_a_fixed_duration
Description: The duration between the start and end date of a sprint is fixed and cannot be changed once started.

Name: a_worker_belongs_to_one_team
Description: Each worker must be assigned to exactly one team at any given time to ensure focus.

Name: a_product_owner_manages_the_backlog
Description: Every Product Backlog must be managed by exactly one Product Owner.

Name: blocker_must_be_resolved_to_close_task
Description: A task with an active blocker cannot have its status set to 'done'.

Name: user_story_must_have_acceptance_criteria
Description: A user story cannot be considered 'ready' for a sprint unless it has defined acceptance criteria.
